title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A -
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - 
Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Restrictions upon Travel to the State from 
Certain States) (No. 5) (Amendment) Regulations 2022.

Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 1947
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 1947 
(Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Restrictions upon Travel to 
the State from Certain States) (No. 5) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 135 of 2021).
text_norm: 3 regulation principal regulation mean health act 1947 (section 31a - temporary restrictions) (covid-19) (restrictions upon travel state certain states) (no 5) regulation 2021 (s.i no 135 2021)

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 4. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
4. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) 

in the definition of “exempted traveller” – 

(i) 

(ii) 

in paragraph (f), by the substitution of “State,” for “State, 
or”, 

in paragraph (g), by the substitution of “be, or” for “be;”, 
and 

(iii) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 

(g): 

“(ga) a person who – 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 11th January, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [4] 3 

(i) 

arrives in the State from a relevant state, 
or having been in a relevant state during 
the period of 14 days prior to so arriving, 
and 

(ii) 

is the holder of a valid – 

(I) 

proof of vaccination, or 

(II) certificate of recovery;”, and 

(b) by the substitution of the following definition for the definition of 

“relevant test result”: 

“ ‘relevant test result’ means – 

(a) 

in relation to a person, any record or evidence, in 
written or electronic form, confirming that – 

(i) 

the person has been subject to a RT-PCR test, 

(ii) 

such test was administered to the person no 
more than 72 hours before the person arrives in 
the State, and 

(iii) Covid-19, or the virus SARS-CoV-2, was not 
detected in the person at the time of taking the 
test, or 

(b) 

in relation to a person who has been infected with 
Covid-19, or the virus SARS-CoV-2, any record or 
evidence, in written or electronic form, confirming 
that – 

(i) 

the person has been subject to a RT-PCR test, 

(ii) 

such RT-PCR test was administered to the 
person no less than 11 days prior to the date on 
which the person arrives in the State and no 
more than 180 days prior to the date on which 
the person so arrives, and 

(iii) Covid-19, or the virus SARS-CoV-2, was 
detected in the person at the time of taking the 
RT-PCR test;”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 5. Regulation 5 of the Principal Regulations is amended, in paragraph (1A),
text_raw:
5. Regulation 5 of the Principal Regulations is amended, in paragraph (1A), 
by the substitution of “A person who is an exempted traveller by virtue of 
paragraph (ga) of the definition of that term who” for “A relevant traveller who 
is the holder of a valid proof of vaccination or a valid certificate of recovery 
and”.
text_norm: 5 regulation 5 principal regulation amended paragraph (1a) substitution person exempted traveller virtue paragraph (ga) definition term relevant traveller holder valid proof vaccination valid certificate recovery

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 6. Regulation 6 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
6. Regulation 6 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) by the deletion of paragraphs (5A), (5B) and (5C), and 

 
 
 
 4 [4] 

(b) 

in paragraph (6), by the substitution of “(1), (3) and (5)” for “ (1), 
(3), (5) and (5A)”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 7. Regulation 7 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution
text_raw:
7. Regulation 7 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution 

of the following paragraph for paragraph (2): 

“(2) 
Paragraphs (1)(b) and (1)(c) shall not apply in relation to a person 
whose arrival in the State is organised, effected or facilitated by a travel 
organiser where the person declares to the travel organiser, or an officer, 
employee or agent of the travel organiser, that he or she is an exempted 
traveller.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

6 January, 2022. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [4] 5

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary 
Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Restrictions upon Travel to the State from States) (No. 
5) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 135 of 2021) to remove the requirement for 
overseas travellers to Ireland who are vaccinated or recovered from COVID-19 
to present evidence of a negative or non-detected COVID-19 test result carried 
out prior to departure. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [4]
